name: Tapestry Connector
summary: Learn about .TAPESTRY files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Iconfactory released Tapestry in February 2025 to enable users to unify various content sources, such as blogs, social media platforms, RSS feeds, podcasts, and YouTube channels, into a single, chronological timeline. The app includes built-in connectors that work with many prominent sources, such as RSS, Tumblr, and Mastodon.

However, Tapestry users can also download and add third-party connectors to work with additional sources with a publicly accessible feed on the Internet. For example, a user can download a TAPESTRY connector from the web that adds Discourse forums to their timeline, which they can filter by category or tag.

description: A TAPESTRY file is a connector file used by The Iconfactory Tapestry, a content feed aggregator for iOS and iPadOS. It contains information describing a feed and instructions for how Tapestry can load it. Users can install TAPESTRY connectors in Tapestry to add supported apps and services from which the app can pull feeds.

instructions: You can open TAPESTRY files with Tapestry on an iOS device. To open a TAPESTRY file:
Open Tapestry settings, and tap Connectors, then select Add a Connector.
Choose the TAPESTRY file you want to open and install.
Go to Settings â†’ Connectors, and select the connector.
